result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven D Harrington-Glover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: All court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA ; All applicable fees of supervision. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOCs from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING (29 pages) commencing FEBRUARY 8, 2016 received and filed.
Bail Bond Refund Packet
2/12/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant Steven D Harrington-Glover in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS with 7 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Steven D Harrington-Glover in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for sentencing on 02/08/2016 at 8:30am.

Defendant Steven D Harrington-Glover in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentencing, however defense requests more time.  Medical record received and filed.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
AMENDED PSI Report received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.
PSI Report received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.
Court also addresses Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.

Defendant Steven D Harrington-Glover in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Pursuant to negotiations, Count 2 is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court Orders PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
